column4: does someoene can give me some tricks to resolve my dns problem ?
Explain your DNS problem.
So basically you're making your own DNS server locally?
Can I ask why? I might be able to suggest a less involved solution.
Hmm, you mean your ISP has bad DNS serv.ers? I set my DNS to 4.2.2.1, 4.2.2.2, and 4.2.2.3 because my ISP's DNS servers where having hiccups lately
I plan to have several website on it and to manage mails using gmail
It's to configure the dns for the domain aladyo.be
Ohh I see what you're doing. I got confused sorry.
So you're trying to get a domain (aladyo.be) to your IP address then?
Yes, that right!
The domain is already forwarding to this IP
The domain is already forwarding to this fixed IP
Yeah I understand. So if I were to ping the domain it would ping your IP?
Yes but right now, he doesn't succeed to resolve the aladyo.Be domain, because dns are not set correctly on the ubuntu server
Hmm. There's gotta be a better solution. Who is providing the domain?

Sorry I guess I misunderstood the problem initially. What I would suggest is going to no-ip.com and setting up a subdomain there and setting it to point to your IP, then setting your domain to point to your subdomain there.
I have it set up at entercomm.no-ip.biz forwarding to my IP address now, and if I wanted a domain all I'd do is point it to that no-ip.biz address since they update their servers within 5 minutes.
Ok, I guess I've helped as much as I can. Sorry I can't do more but it's worth looking into (even with a static IP) as it would seem simpler to me.
What I did was sign up for an account there, add a record, set the IP address to my broadband connection here at work and no-ip.com automatically updates it once you set itup.
Nope. no-ip set up DNS. You can even ping that address and it will go to my router as it's set up correctly. No need for having a local DNS server at all.
You're welcome. I hope that makes things simple for you. :)
